ay: Ah alas Ay me I fondly dream Had ye been there Milton Same as Aye Yes yea a word expressing assent or an affirmative answer to a question It is much used in viva voce voting in legislative bodies etc Note This word is written I in the early editions of Shakespeare and other old writers Always ever continually for an indefinite time For his mercies aye endure Milton For aye always forever eternally
ayah: A native nurse for children also a lady s maid India
aye: Yes yea a word expressing assent or an affirmative answer to a question It is much used in viva voce voting in legislative bodies etc Note This word is written I in the early editions of Shakespeare and other old writers An affirmative vote one who votes in the affirmative as To call for the ayes and noes The ayes have it Always ever continually for an indefinite time For his mercies aye endure Milton For aye always forever eternally
aye-aye: A singular nocturnal quadruped allied to the lemurs found in Madagascar Cheiromys Madagascariensis remarkable for its long fingers sharp nails and rodent like incisor teeth
ayle: A grandfather Obs Writ of Ayle an ancient English writ which lay against a stranger who had dispossessed the demandant of land of which his grandfather died seized
ayme: The utterance of the ejaculation Ay me Obs See Ay interj Aymees and hearty heigh hoes J Fletcher
ayrshire: One of a superior breed of cattle from Ayrshire Scotland Ayrshires are notable for the quantity and quality of their milk
ayuntamiento: In Spain and Spanish America a corporation or body of magistrates in cities and towns corresponding to mayor and aldermen
